title: How to Make Instant Mashed Potatoes

steps.headline: Measure the water, salt, and butter into a pot.
steps.description: Set a one-quart (0.9 liter) pot on the stove and pour 1 cup (240 ml) of water into it. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon (1 g) of salt and 1 1/2 tablespoons (21 g) of butter or margarine.

steps.headline: Bring the water to a boil.
steps.description: Turn the heat on to medium-high and bring the mixture to a boil. The butter should melt and combine with the water.

steps.headline: Turn off the heat and stir in the milk.
steps.description: If you don't want to use the 1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk, you could stir in chicken stock, vegetable stock, or water.

steps.headline: Stir in the instant potato flakes and let them stand for 30 seconds.
steps.description: Measure 1 cup (60 g) of instant potato flakes into the pot. Stir the instant potatoes well so they absorb the liquid. Rest the instant potatoes for about 30 seconds to fully hydrate and expand.

steps.headline: Fluff the instant mashed potatoes and serve them.
steps.description: Take a fork and gently fluff or whip the mashed potatoes. Divide the mashed potatoes into three portions and serve them immediately. You can store leftover instant mashed potatoes in an airtight container in the refrigerator for three to five days.

steps.headline: Measure the water, salt, butter, and milk into a bowl.
steps.description: Get out a medium-sized microwave-safe bowl and pour 1 cup (240 ml) of water and 1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk into it. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon (1 g) of salt and 1 1/2 tablespoons (21 g) of butter or margarine. If you don't want to use milk, you could substitute chicken stock, vegetable stock, or extra water.

steps.headline: Stir in the potato flakes.
steps.description: Measure 1 cup (60 g) of instant potato flakes into the bowl and stir them into the liquids until they're just absorbed. Put a lid on the bowl. If you don't have a lid for the bowl, you can cover it with a microwave-safe plate that fits over the bowl.

steps.headline: Microwave the instant mashed potatoes for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
steps.description: Put the bowl in the microwave and microwave the instant mashed potatoes on full power for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Stir and serve the instant mashed potatoes.
steps.description: Use oven mitts to carefully take the hot bowl of instant mashed potatoes out of the microwave. Take the lid off of the bowl and use a fork to stir the mashed potatoes. Serve them while they're still hot. Transfer any leftovers to an airtight container and refrigerate them. You'll need to use them within three to five days.

steps.headline: Include garlic powder.
steps.description: For a savory flavor, add 1/2 teaspoon (1.5 g) of garlic powder to the water before you heat it. Avoid using fresh, minced garlic since these may cook unevenly and won't dissolve as well as powdered garlic.

steps.headline: Stir a little sour cream into the instant mashed potatoes.
steps.description: Once the instant mashed potatoes have finished cooking on the stove or in the microwave, stir in 1/3 cup (230 g) of sour cream. It will give the instant mashed potatoes a rich, creamy flavor and texture. You can also use plain yogurt or a few spoonfuls of cream cheese.

steps.headline: Replace the water with a richer dairy product.
steps.description: Instead of heating water, use half and half or evaporated milk. These will give a creamier taste and smoother texture since the fat will help bind the instant potato flakes.

steps.headline: Top the instant mashed potatoes with cheese and herbs.
steps.description: Sprinkle a generous handful of shredded cheddar cheese, grated parmesan, or blue cheese crumbles. You can also mix in fresh chopped chives or parsley for a loaded baked potato flavor.
